abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education System
            Realignment and Strengthening Project, the second phase of
            the Education System Realignment and Strengthening Program
            Project, is to increase the quality and efficiency of
            primary and secondary education in Georgia. The closing date
            of the project will be extended from December 31, 2010 until
            August 31, 2011. The extension is necessary to allow for the
            completion of ongoing activities under the complementing
            Policy and Human Resource Development (PHRD) grant, which
            finances key reform elements directly linked to the
            achievement of several outcome indicators. The activities
            financed by the PHRD grant suffered delays due to several
            reorganizations at the Ministry of education and science and
            at the two implementing agencies, the National Curriculum
            and Assessment Center (NCAC) and the Teacher Professional
            Development Center (TPDC).
